text.p: When we apply the linear transformation [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^2 \rightarrow \mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] given by [mathjaxinline]T(x) = \left[ \begin{array}{cc} -1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] to the image, which picture is the result?

font.p: We see that [mathjaxinline]T\Bigg(\left[ \begin{array}{c} a\\ b\end{array} \right]\Bigg)=\left[ \begin{array}{cc} -1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{array} \right]\left[ \begin{array}{c} a\\ b\end{array}\right]=\left[ \begin{array}{c} -a\\ b\end{array}\right][/mathjaxinline] and thus [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] reflects the original image over the [mathjaxinline]y-[/mathjaxinline]axis.
